title: Nobuhisa Yamada
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Yamada mainly played on the right as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> or <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>. He spent his entire professional career at <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Urawa Reds</a> of <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> with more than 500 league appearances. He earned 15 caps playing for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan</a>.
Club career.
Yamada was educated at and played for Fujieda Higashi High School. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Urawa Reds</a> in 1994. He made his first league appearance on 27 April 1994 against <a href="Shimizu%20S-Pulse">Shimizu S-Pulse</a> at <a href="Kusanagi%20Athletic%20Stadium">Kusanagi Athletic Stadium</a>. His first professional goal came on 19 November 1994 against <a href="Yokohama%20F.%20Marinos">Yokohama Marinos</a> at <a href="Toyama%20Stadium">Toyama Stadium</a>.
Although he mainly played as a right-side defender or midfielder, he had also played as a stopper, libero, and attacking midfielder. He played more than 500 league matches for Urawa and also served captain from 2004 to 2008. The club won the champions <a href="2006%20J.League%20Division%201">2006 J1 League</a>, <a href="2003%20J.League%20Cup">2003 J.League Cup</a>, <a href="2005%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">2005</a> and <a href="2006%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">2006 Emperor's Cup</a>. In Asia, the club won the champions <a href="2007%20AFC%20Champions%20League">2007 AFC Champions League</a> and the 3rd place <a href="2007%20FIFA%20Club%20World%20Cup">2007 FIFA Club World Cup</a>.
He announced his retirement from the game at the end of the 2013 season.
National team career.
Yamada represented Japan at several underage levels. He was a member of the <a href="Japan%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Japan U-20 national team</a> for the <a href="1995%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">1995 FIFA World Youth Championship</a> hosted by <a href="Qatar">Qatar</a>. He played all 4 matches as right midfielder and scored a goal against <a href="Burundi%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Burundi</a>.
He made his full international debut for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan</a> on 20 November 2002 in a friendly against <a href="Argentine%20national%20football%20team">Argentine</a> at <a href="Saitama%20Stadium%202002">Saitama Stadium 2002</a>. In 2003, he played most matches as right side-back including <a href="2003%20FIFA%20Confederations%20Cup">2003 Confederations Cup</a>. His first international goal came on 7 February 2004 in a friendly against <a href="Malaysia%20national%20football%20team">Malaysia</a> at <a href="Kashima%20Soccer%20Stadium">Kashima Soccer Stadium</a>. He played 15 games and scored 1 goal for Japan until 2004.
